title: Hopefully make handling of classes, class changes, and battle command changes better. [P]
message:
Hopefully make handling of classes, class changes, and battle command changes better. [P]

This fixes handling of classes, with the new consideration that "changed_class" is actually more "changed_battle_commands", and what this implies.
Specifically that any code relying on changed_class's old meaning is based on a lie.
It also fixes handling of battle command changes, now that '-1 in the array means check LDB' is pretty clearly false

(But '-1 as a LSD class_id means check LDB' is true, which suggests possible miscommunication somewhere.)

title: Merge pull request #1303 from Ghabry/vehicle
message:
Merge pull request #1303 from Ghabry/vehicle

Implement even more obscure SetVehicleLocation behaviour

title: SetVehicleLocation actually supports changing the map without doing a transition…
message:
SetVehicleLocation actually supports changing the map without doing a transition while the party is boarded but only when the target map has an event with the same event ID.

Because this sounds more like a bug than intended behaviour this was implemented using a normal teleport and without a check if the target map has a valid event. Doesn't match the RPG_RT behaviour due to the transition but this bug is strange and only used by a few VIPRPG games, not worth implementing perfectly.

message:
Support for GetActors() parameters in ChangeClass and ChangeBattleCommands

Yup, that thing I suspected was there, actually turned out to be there in testing!
I am going to definitely need to ship you my testcase with the PR for this, I can tell.

title: Hopefully fix #1198 by removing original_pattern
message:
Hopefully fix #1198 by removing original_pattern

original_pattern isn't actually RPG_RT behavior, apparently - the issue 1198 shows this.

I made a testcase, but not much of one.
 I had hoped to check different ways of setting the pattern,
 but apparently walking and page changes are the only things that do it.

So, test this with stuff before considering applying.
Thanks to Ghabry for basically doing most of the work.
The technical description given plus a look through the code showed original_pattern wasn't being honoured, and now I know why.

title: Fix encoding detection. This was caused by a liblcf API change that requires a…
message:
Fix encoding detection. This was caused by a liblcf API change that requires a istream now to do encoding detection for the database.

Otherwise this will only detect the passed string (rpg_rt.ldb) which is correctly detected as UTF-8.

Remove the "+2" magic number in Player::UpdateScroll. This was used to fix Smashbros but in the meanwhile the scrolling doesn't need this workaround anymore.

Removing this fixes a hang in the custom battle system of Celestial Silfade Story (シルフェイド幻想譚).

title: Move to the next event before yielding the interpreter when "Erase Event" is…
message:
Move to the next event before yielding the interpreter when "Erase Event" is called from a parallel process.
This prevents a hang when a PP uses "Call Event" and the called event erases itself.

Fix #1243

title: Don't check for Action Events or Vehicles while a event is starting.
message:
Don't check for Action Events or Vehicles while a event is starting.
This makes the behaviour consistent with movement tests.
Prevents starting of action events while an autorun event is starting and fixes the elevator in HOME.

Fix #1109

title: When a KeyInput waits for a key press the target variable is set to 0 each frame.
message:
When a KeyInput waits for a key press the target variable is set to 0 each frame.
This was already implemented before but had two bugs:
1. In the first frame the variable wasn't set
2. For non-wait the variable was set, too

The 1st bug fixes #1217

title: Refresh the Map directly when a move command toggled a switch.
message:
Refresh the Map directly when a move command toggled a switch.
This fixes a incorrect looking direction when the move route changed the direction and the switch invokes a new page.

Before the new page direction applied, now the move route direction applies.
Fixes a broken church cutscene in Desolate City - The Bloody Dawn.

title: Handle selection of Battle & Battle2 animations depending on the RPG::Animation large field.
message:
Handle selection of Battle & Battle2 animations depending on the RPG::Animation large field.

title: Run autostart events that become runnable this frame only when the event ID of…
message:
Run autostart events that become runnable this frame only when the event ID of the autostart event is higher than the ID of the event which triggered a refresh.
For events with lower IDs the start is delayed by one frame which replicated the RPG_RT behaviour.

This fixes a hang when going through the east gate in Violated Heroine.

Fix #1132

title: Don't apply a direction change when a new event page is executed when the old…
message:
Don't apply a direction change when a new event page is executed when the old page and new page direction are the same.
Fix #1226

The patch provided in #1020 was incorrect because it used the current character direction instead of the new page direction.

title: Fix #1160; regression from 7f83a3bf
message:
Fix #1160; regression from 7f83a3bf

This was caused by a bad refactor. Previously we had

    to scroll up:
      parallax_y += min(dist, dist * A/B)
    to scroll down:
      parallax_y -= min(dist, dist * A/B)

I refactored to handle scrolling up as a special case of scrolling
down with a negative distance, but did not update the minimum, which
changes to a maximum on negation (-min(x, y) = max(-x, -y)).

This is now

    to scroll down:
      parallax_y -= closer_to_zero(dist, dist * A/B)

which is correct in both cases (the two arguments have the same sign
and therefore closer_to_zero(x,y) is min(x,y) if they are positive
and max(x,y) if they are negative.)

title: Use ttyp0 for RM2k3E
message:
Use ttyp0 for RM2k3E

The original idea behind using Japanese fonts for the official
English release was that it used MS Mincho/MS Gothic. However,
upon closer inspection I've noticed that the official releases
use EDITED MS Mincho and MS Gothic (in the official RM2kE, they
are called RPG2000 and RPG2000G), and those edited fonts use
a European … and not Japanese). So, I think it’s safe to lump
them alongside with the unofficial translations and use ttyp0
for them.

title: Add fonts compatible with RMG2000 and RM2000 for unofficial translations
message:
Add fonts compatible with RMG2000 and RM2000 for unofficial translations

Japanese fonts have a few quirks that don’t need to be reproduced
in other languages. So, it makes sense to have separate Japanese
fonts for official translations, and other fonts for unofficial
translations.

The major differences of Japanese fonts are:

— ` (grave accent) is opening quote,
— ' (straight apostrophe) is a closing quote,
— " (straight double quote) is a closing double quote,
— Cyrillic and Greek characters are double-width,
— ellipsis is in the middle of the line (also useful for Chinese
and maybe Korean).

For RMG2000, a font similar to Shinonome is used (but without the
peculiarities described above).

For RM2000, a new font is added. Like Don Miguel's RM2000, it has different
style for Cyrillic and Latin, Cyrillic is bigger than Latin. For
Cyrillic, I've used a 'straight italic' style (so-called Bulgarian cyrillic).
Its look-and-feel is similar to Don's RM2000 font.

Also fixed this for the defeat and the escape handler but here the bug is only possible through a malformed database because the "Execute handler" settings are part of the Enemy encounter dialog, so they are always generated when these options are on.

title: Fix BG bug introduced in fc546f70
message:
Fix BG bug introduced in fc546f70

The assumption that a map had finite height caused rendering issues.
The y-direction doesn't need to be considered, but it was included
to make the map representable as a Rect. When the map loops
vertically, this is impossible and caused the bug.

Solved by inlining the call to Rect::Adjust and removing all handling
of the y-direction.

message:
Refactor Game_Picture

Rather than providing individual getters and setters, provide
monolithic Show/Move/Erase methods so that the logic of how setting
values differs between eg. Show and Move can be moved into the
relevant members.

Also fixes a tiny bug(?) in PicPointerPatch handling of bottom_trans.

message:
Merge pull request #1104 from scurest/rand

Make RNG portable

title: Improve docs for SeedRandomNumberGenerator
message: Improve docs for SeedRandomNumberGenerator

title: Add GetRandomU32
message:
Add GetRandomU32

The point is to document that GetRandomUnsigned depends on the range
of the RNG being [0, U32_MAX], which is true for MT19937, but might
not be if it ever changes.

title: Remove uniform_int_distribution
message:
Remove uniform_int_distribution

Because the algorithm is not part of the standard, the output of
uniform_int_distribution is not portable. Replace it with hand-rolled
code for GetRandomNumber.

title: Replace rand with Utils::GetRandomNumber
message:
Replace rand with Utils::GetRandomNumber

Completely removes old-style RNG. This improves reproducability of
runs with --replay-input and -seed (in small tests, the save files
only differ in the timestamp now).

ChanceOf was also added for the common case of needing a random bool.

title: Soften claims about reproducibility

message:
Merge pull request #1089 from fdelapena/asciidoc

Fix asciidoc manpage generation when using a different working folder

title: Workaround missing move constructor on Android
message:
Workaround missing move constructor on Android

The move-constructor and swap are both missing for ifstream on
Android (old stdlib version?), so there's not much choice but
to construct the ifstream in LogSource itself.

title: Handle reset (F12) in Player instead of UI
message:
Handle reset (F12) in Player instead of UI

This entails adding a new InputButton, RESET. Handling resetting
in Player lets it work with input recording/replaying.

title: Allow replaying input logs
message:
Allow replaying input logs

A new Input::Source is added that reads pressed_buttons from the
log file written by --record-input. Another command-line arg is added
to select the log file for replaying.

If --seed is also used, this *should* give perfectly reproducible
runs of a game (eg. for automated testing, etc.). Main caveat is that
resetting the game (with F12) does not go through the Input
module so it doesn't get reproduced.

title: Allow recording input to a log file
message:
Allow recording input to a log file

A command line arg now allows recording pressed_buttons to an
fstream.

Since Input::Init can now be affected by the CLI args, calling it
was moved into Player::Init (Graphics::Init was moved too because
it needs to be done before we use Output::Warning to signal that
the log file wasn't opened properly.) I also cleared out remaining
apparently-unused includes from main().

title: Introduce Input::Source
message:
Introduce Input::Source

Presently Input reads data from the UI, sets its state, and supplies
its state to the engine. A Source abstracts over where the incoming
data comes from. The only currently available source is UiSource,
which reads data from the UI, making Input behave just as it did
before this commit.

title: Add large CharSet support
message:
Add large CharSet support
This recovers large CharSet support removed since #137 fix,
allowing CharSet files starting with a dollar sign to be
calculated by 4x2 SpriteSets. This differs from VX Ace behavior.
The purpose of using large 4x2 spritesets instead individual
spritesets like VX Ace does is to keep reduced file access
on games wanting to use multiple large characters.
Also keeps code lesser complicated for this custom feature.

./bdfmerge.pl 0x4E00--0x9FCB wenquanyi_9pt.bdf > wenquanyi_cjk_basic_9pt.bdf

0x4E00--0x9FFF is section of Unicdoe CJK Basic.
WenQuanYi(wqy) is Unicode 5.2 fonts, so 0x4E00--0x9FCB.

title: Delay teleport when a parallel interpreter calls Show/EraseScreen.
message:
Delay teleport when a parallel interpreter calls Show/EraseScreen.

RPG_RT does not yield the interpreter when doing Transitions compared to our code which does the transition in the graphic update.
Due to this a pending teleport is executed directly after a Show/EraseScreen due to our yield. This means it is executed too early and events following a Show or Erase screen are not executed after a map change (which is wrong).
By inventing an additional flag the teleport is delayed (= not executed) when the interpreter yields due to a Show/EraseScreen, continuing the event execution on the same map as expected one frame later.

It's possible that this causes some timing issues but this flag is only relevant for the mentioned corner case.
Show/Erase on the main interpreter will not toggle it (typical Parallel vs. Main inconsistency in RPG_RT).

Fix #1032

title: Autotools: Work around an absolute path problem
message:
Autotools: Work around an absolute path problem
Problem: `make distcheck` will perform a `./configure --prefix` call,
that fails when using an absolute path for installing a file (in our
case bash completion). This also happens when a user has no root rights
and want to install in their /home or somewhere.
Solution: bend the path to use the autotools $prefix variable.
Unfortunately this has some sideeffects, because of using pkg-config
directly and needing a way to disable this behaviour alltogether.
This ugly (sic!) way attempts to work with either:
* --with-bash-completion-dir == --with-bash-completion-dir=yes
* --without-bash-completion-dir == --with-bash-completion-dir=no
* --with-bash-completion-dir=/some/path
While the last option will not work with --prefix installs, when given
an absolute path without write permissions, it would be stupid to use
one in a read-only dir anyways.

title: Autotools: Just check if `malloc` exists
message:
Autotools: Just check if `malloc` exists
This avoids an autotools flaw when cross-compiling with some toolchains
or when an address sanitizer is used (the configure test returns
non-null then, because malloc is used without free and the sanitizer
observes this of course) It then wants to use a replacement function,
which results in an error (`::malloc has not been declared`).

title: Battle interpreter changes: Only search for runnable pages when the scene says…
message:
Battle interpreter changes: Only search for runnable pages when the scene says that it is a good time to run the interpreter at certain points.
Only reset "X used command" pages when that actor had another turn.

In the old behaviour the interpreter always looked in each update-loop if a page can run. This makes sense for the map but not at all for the battle because the only time when pages run is when the turn starts.
The interpreter behaves now correctly in OFF (uses conditional branch) and in Ara Fell (uses event page condition) for "X used command".
The timing when the page runs is now also correct. RPG2k3 behaviour should be perfectly replecated now.

Fix #488
Fix #983

message: Improve engine detection heuristic for games that have ldb_id 2003 but look like 2000 games which don't use any 2003 feature (fixes .flow)

This fixes a regression introduced in 81c910a5.

title: Run UpdateSelfMovement before updating move state.
message:
Run UpdateSelfMovement before updating move state.

This brings events into line with the player: previously, when an event moved, Update() would run for that movement for the first time on the next frame, but for the player it was on the same frame.

Catepillar system in Pom Gets Wifi appears to be fixed now.

title: Extend #884 to move the player early too.
message:
Extend #884 to move the player early too.

For #703, Shibe no longer blocks your movements. However, he still
trails your movement by one frame.

title: Fix #884.
message:
Fix #884.

Game_Character::IsPassable becomes Game_Character::MakeWay, which does the same
thing but tries to update events to make room for self. Additionally, only one
pass through the events is made to check both the old and new coordinate.

title: Tweak event movement routes
message:
Tweak event movement routes

Push the move routes methods down in the Game_Event class.

If an event can't do a step, it won't turn to the direction of the
failed step. This is done to make the movement look more natural.

In MoveTypeRandom: After using a dynrpg plugin to print the values of
stepFrameCounter (in liblcf: stop_count) and frequencyTimer (in
liblcf:max_stop_count), I've simulated the randomness of these two
variables. After about 1000 steps, 38% of the steps were forward steps
in RPG_RT, while 70% in Player. This has been reduced to 40% in Player.

message: Make blitting on the Map smarter. Draw bottom opaque when no panorama exists, otherwise with alpha. This saves an extra background graphic draw.

message: Determine blit operation for bitmap and tilemaps beforehand based on transparency of the image. Will prefer OP_SRC over _OVER when nothing is transparent.

title: Speedup hardlight and saturation blits.
message:
Speedup hardlight and saturation blits.
Hard Light uses now a lookup table and the code is almost branch free. The table hurts the cache because of it's size but is faster then without cache because hard light requires branching.
Saturation saves now one allocation and one OVER blit.

title: Emscripten: Do not normalize file and folder names
message:
Emscripten: Do not normalize file and folder names
The whole magic to map lowercase filenames and directories to the
"real" ones is not needed as the serverside script will take care of
this and only return valid names.
As a side effect, this also fixes the mangling of utf8 encoded filenames
in japanese games (i.e. yume nikki).

title: Emscripten: Avoid crashes in the filefinder
message:
Emscripten: Avoid crashes in the filefinder
Newer Emscripten versions create some directories in the root (/).
However, filefinder does not like them and crashes in the lstat()
function while trying to access some of them.
If we move into a "private" easyrpg directory, these are not accessed.

Fix #700, #731, #756. Prepare for #87, #383, #624.

title: Make patch warning more clear
message: Make patch warning more clear

title: Do not fade out music effects
message:
Do not fade out music effects
(ME is unused and will be removed some day)

title: Add a small icon to the window/task bar under Windows
message:
Add a small icon to the window/task bar under Windows
This is most of the time 16x16 pixels, but can be larger depending on
DPI setting.
Do not close if the icon failed to load under any platform.

title: Add logo in higher resolutions to windows icon
message:
Add logo in higher resolutions to windows icon
Also add the used gimp source file. The icon now has 15 layers:

 .-----------------> format
 |    .------------> dimensions
 |    |        .---> bit depth/alpha bit depth
 |    |        |
ICO 16x16   8/1+32/8
ICO 20x20   8/1+32/8
ICO 24x24   8/1+32/8
ICO 32x32   8/1+32/8
ICO 40x40   32/8
ICO 48x48   8/1
ICO 48x48   32/8
ICO 64x64   32/8
ICO 96x96   32/8
ICO 128x128 32/8
PNG 256x256 32/8

Some of the smaller ones are used with odd DPI settings, some are
needed for high DPI screens.

title: Let SDL handle the window icon for other platforms
message:
Let SDL handle the window icon for other platforms
Under Windows the icon will be set again, if the window mode changes.
This should work across window recreations and fixes the disappearing
icon under Windows. Related SDL issue: 1919 [1]
Issue and fix in short: SDL needs to recreate the window sometimes and
only puts the icon back in, if set through SDL before. As we set it
ourselves for Windows, it got lost.

[1]: https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1919

title: Add a 32x32 pixel RGBA icon as header file
message:
Add a 32x32 pixel RGBA icon as header file
It is used for the task bar and task switcher under Linux and OS X.
Disable window icons for SDL1.2 builds.

title: Use a portable integer type
message: Use a portable integer type

title: Set window title to game name when known, warn if not
message:
Set window title to game name when known, warn if not
This removes the window title setting from UI, as game name is not
available at this point, instead uses the generic application name now
first.
Before this change, the window title was set to an empty string, causing
the window manager to name the window 'Unknown Window' in the task lists
and such. For fullscreen windows, this would last until close. For
windows not in fullscreen state, this was 'fixed' after a second by
Graphics::UpdateTitle().
Related: #383

title: Replicate the weird behavior of move routes and triggers
message:
Replicate the weird behavior of move routes and triggers

While on a move route, the player shall not trigger touch/collision
events. When the move route ends (by reaching the last command or by
using Halt All Movement), it'll check the touch/collision triggers if
the last command executed was a Move command.

Fixes #687

title: Remove the map update just before teleporting
message:
Remove the map update just before teleporting

Only the commands of the event with the teleport should be executed. The
parallel event case is already handled correctly since 103fe309. If the
event isn't parallel, it should resume when
Scene_Map::FinishTeleportPlayer is called.

title: Remove unsafe deletion of drawable objects at Graphics::Quit
message:
Remove unsafe deletion of drawable objects at Graphics::Quit

Graphics::Quit deletes all the objects pointed in state and
global_state. This might cause an invalidation of the iterator in use
through RemoveDrawable and a double free corruption. Only Output's
MessageOverlay isn't deleted at that point.

title: Optimize screen effects drawing
message:
Optimize screen effects drawing

Screen::Draw copies the whole display surface apply changes to it and then replaces the surface with its copy (even if there are no screen effects).  Now it modifies the display surface directly like other drawable objects.

title: Update events' move routes after their commands
message:
Update events' move routes after their commands

Checking if a move route has ended is now done after the move route for-
loop. This used to be before the for-loop to make sure the move route
was cleaned a frame after it had ended. That way the ProceedWithMovement
would let the event script keep running at the correct frame.
However, things get complicated if the move route and the
ProceedWithMovement commands are in different events. Let's call these
events A and B respectively. If A has a smaller ID than B, it turns out
that B passes through the ProceedWithMovement in the same frame A's move
route ends. But A would need another frame to surpass a
ProceedWithMovement.
That means that A's route is updated after its commands

title: Merge pull request #430 from scurest/iss358
message:
Merge pull request #430 from scurest/iss358

Fix #358

title: Remove unused parameters, and other warnings.
message:
Remove unused parameters, and other warnings.

Removes unused parameters, some alignment, and signed/unsigned
comparison. Also adds a missing cleanup case to WritePNG.

title: More small tweaks to PNG reader.
message: More small tweaks to PNG reader.

title: Avoid allocating temporary array.
message:
Avoid allocating temporary array.

When writing a row of pixel data, instead of using a temporary
buffer of width w to hold the indices, put them in the last
w bytes of the row of pixel data. Then the index->RGBA loop looks
like

    read nth index (from offset 3w+n)
    convert to color
    write color to nth pixel (offsets 4n..4n+3)

To check we don't overwrite a byte holding an index we'll later
need, we need to know that the offset of the last byte written,
4n+3, is less than the offset of the next byte read, 3w+(n+1).
4n+3 < 3w+(n+1) is equivalent to n < w-2/3, which is true since
n <= w-1.

title: Change 'PaletteData' to 'PalettedData' to prevent confusion.
message: Change 'PaletteData' to 'PalettedData' to prevent confusion.

title: Fix #358.
message:
Fix #358.

Changes the PNG reader for paletted images to use the index of a
pixel to decide its transparency, rather than its color. This caused
pixels with non-zero index to be transparent if their index's color
happened to be the same as index 0's color.

Unfortunately, the indexed color -> RGBA conversion was being done
in libpng, so EasyRPG never saw the indices to begin with. So it
requires fairly invasive changes. For the sake of symmetry, I pulled
out functions for non-indexed images too. Not very pretty.

title: Let parallel interpreters run with visible messages
message:
Let parallel interpreters run with visible messages

Parallel interpreters ignore other interpreters' messages and will keep
on running. They only stop when they are the "owner" of the displayed
message. The main interpreter is more polite and stops at any message.

title: Correct face handling with parallel processes
message:
Correct face handling with parallel processes

The following behaviour seems to mimic RPG_RT well:
a) parallel processes never clear faces; face sett in a parallel process
execution exists after it is ended (however, it can only be visible in
other parallel process's Show Message, or in events that use Wait command),
b) non-parallel events clear faces when their execution begins and ends.

title: Merge pull request #336 from rohkea/master
message:
Merge pull request #336 from rohkea/master

Add Korean characters from Baekmuk Gulim font

title: Add Korean characters from Baekmuk Gulim font
message:
Add Korean characters from Baekmuk Gulim font

Add all the characters from Baekmuk Gulim font except the ones
that already exist in Shinonome. This includes all the Hangeul and
a part of Hanja (which will be useful for Traditional Chinese).

Hanja were shifted 1px to the left and 1px to the bottom to fit into
Shinonome better. Unfortunately, this may still be not enough (Shinonome
doesn’t really have a margin, often placing single dots and other
characters in the topmost line and rightmost column, while Gulim
always has these lines without any pixels), so Chinese characters
may require some editing to fit the Shinonome style.

Hanja are also useful for Traditional Chinese; however, many more
characters are needed for normal Chinese support. Currently, some
basic words (like nei5/ni3 'you') are still missing.

title: Merge pull request #245 from rohkea/master
message:
Merge pull request #245 from rohkea/master

Make font encoding UTF-32LE, add full Cyrillic + Latin Extended A

title: Cleanup: kanji_encoding is no longer used
message: Cleanup: kanji_encoding is no longer used

title: Make font encoding UTF-32LE, add full Cyrillic + Latin Extended A
message:
Make font encoding UTF-32LE, add full Cyrillic + Latin Extended A

This commit changes the font encoding (kanji_encoding) to UTF32-LE to
allow using the full Unicode for fonts. Also, it adds the Cyrillic Unicode
block (except pre-1917 letters) and a complete Latin Extended A Unicode
block.

This adds support for Polish, Czech and many languages with no known
published games (Belarusian, Ukrainian, Serbian, Macedonian, Latvian,
Lithuanian, Turkish; also Tatar, Kazakh if encoding 65001 is used).

Unless explicitly stated otherwise (in the commit message), all the
changes I am commiting are available under the Creative Commons Zero
license.

title: BUGFIX: Fix error in the switch validation method.
message:
BUGFIX: Fix error in the switch validation method.

In the Game_Switches_Class::isValidSwitch(int) method, comparison
for the upper bound (< switches.size) was wrong since switch IDs ranges
from 1 to switches.size inclusive.
This caused easyrpg-player to exit with an error message if the game
made use of the last switch.
Replacing the < comparison operator with <= fixes that.

title: Fix general toneblit. Fixes #59 (disable pixman)
message:
Fix general toneblit. Fixes #59 (disable pixman)

PixmanBitmap::ToneBlit() was disabled since the general
Surface::ToneBlit() do the work correctly. We should decide if open an
issue to rewrite this.

title: Implemented alternative rendering method which does not use alpha/opacity
message:
Implemented alternative rendering method which does not use alpha/opacity
when it is not neccessary. #define USE_ALPHA is used to alternate rendering methods.
This is a neccessary step to get some kind of hardware acceleration.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fixed rendering of borders of windows and selectors (working 90% correctly on
non-alpha method, but it still has problems in alpha). RPG_RT actually starts
blitting borders of window from position 0, 0; which is the same position as where
it starts drawing the corners. This is why why it seems like it's missing a part in
alpha mode.
Background of windows show full 32 lines stretched.
Some graphic bitmap have no transparency now. (Closes #62)
Glyphs have shadow now.
Scene Menu shows proper color background.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Moved Reader source files to a new project that generates a static lib.
Player makes now use of this lib instead of compiling its own readers.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Moved old style static variables to a C++ anonymous namespace.
Removed NULL checks before deletes. (delete will do nothing to NULL).
Replaced vector<char> to vector<bool> for RAM saving.
